If you use a telemed service that ships urine tests directly to your house, there are steps you can take to protect yourself in the event that they‚Äôre never shipped or lost in transit.. I‚Äôve read a ton of posts in this sub that go something like this: ‚ÄúMy provider asked me to take a urine test and upload a picture to the app, but I never received my shipment of tests in the mail. My appointment is tomorrow and I‚Äôm really worried that I‚Äôm going to be cut off‚Äù. 

I‚Äôm new to doing MAT online and haven‚Äôt had any problems so far, but I wanted to make sure my tush was covered just in case something like this ever happened to me. I also wanted to share this here with the hope that it means one less thing to worry about for anyone here. MAT has saved my life more than once, but I‚Äôd be lying if I said it didn‚Äôt come with the nagging fear that one small hiccup outside of my control could turn my life upside down all over again. Anyway, I‚Äôll stop rambling and get to my point:

USPS offers a free service called ‚ÄúInformed Delivery‚Äù. They email you each morning with front and back pictures of every envelope/piece of mail arriving that day. The email doesn‚Äôt include packages or boxes, but if you log directly into their website or app, every single package that is addressed to your home (including a tracking number and information on the sender) will appear there the moment a shipping label is created. This will allow you to verify if the tests were even sent in the first place. If they were lost in transit, you‚Äôll be able to see where they ended up or if they ultimately went back to your provider. You can even view packages that were shipped months ago 

If you keep an eye on this and take screenshots as needed (or even better, screenshare with your provider/show them on another device during your video call), this will cover your butt so the liability doesn‚Äôt fall on you. If you‚Äôre hiding the fact that you‚Äôre in MAT from people you live with there‚Äôs no need to worry, this info is only accessible to the person that created the account. They don‚Äôt mail you anything to confirm your enrollment in the service.

I‚Äôm not sure if UPS or FedEx offers a similar service, but many packages shipped via those services will end up in USPS‚Äôs hands at some point in the shipping process (and their Informed Delivery system as a result) anyway, because USPS has a more robust delivery infrastructure and handing packages off ends up being cheaper for FedEx/UPS. 

If your packages are getting stolen, that‚Äôs an entirely different story and unfortunately, the liability would unfortunately fall on you. If this is your issue, I would talk to your provider about instructing USPS to hold your package at your local post office until you can pick it up, or invest in a lock box. 

I hope this helps someone! Let me know if you have any questions.

My life has been challenging to navigate outside of drug treatment‚Ä¶going through major life changes like divorce, becoming a father, deaths in the family, financial issues, career changes‚Ä¶but it has all served to strengthen my resolve, and I am truly in a better place today at 31 than I have been since I was a teenager..I am buying new furniture for my house and investing in my IRA instead of spending that money on pills. 

My advice to you‚Ä¶there is no rush, embrace your journey and don‚Äôt compare yourself to anyone else. Take one small step today in the right direction and envision how consistency & patience will take you to the finish line. Be honest and open with your family and ask them to support you. It took you a while to get where you are, so try to accept that it will take a while to get back to where you want to be & understand that there is a reason for that. 

Good luck to you all..your support has been crucial to my success!

Anyway, I didn‚Äôt want to be on this shit forever and decided I wanted off of it. However the doctor was like you will need to taper and that‚Äôll take a year. I basically was like no way in hell am I going to be on this shit another year. I want to be perfectly clear that for TEN YEARS, I was on 24mg daily and NEVER missed a dose. Period. I‚Äôm a 35 year old female as well with two children so I‚Äôm no spring chicken! So, On 5/27/21 I flew to a detox facility and they did a rapid taper and I took my very last Suboxone ever in my life on 6/4/21. It was the most agonizing lengthy withdraw I‚Äôve ever experienced.
